original_title: Tulsi Gabbard: The UK has agreed to drop its mandate for Apple to provide a "back door" that would have enabled access to the protected encrypted data of American citizens and encroached on our civil liberties.  — The Donald
article_summary: The UK has agreed to drop its demand for Apple to provide access to encrypted data of American citizens, a move praised by some as a protection of civil liberties, while others criticize the UK for allegedly encroaching on American sovereignty and selling out their own country.</s>
